definition: to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
to lift (a lid)/to rock/to convulse
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The spring breeze lifted the edge of her blouse.
He licked a finger and pushed at the pages of the notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他舔了舔手指，掀动他那个笔记本。

sentences.english: The pilot flips a switch and the fuel receptacle door closes.
sentences.chinese: 飞行员掀动开关关闭受油口舱盖。

sentences.english: The fighter pilot flips a switch and the receiver door atop his fuselage drops in.
sentences.chinese: 战斗机的飞行员掀动开关收起机身上方的受油口舱盖。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to open and close (the mouth etc)
to tremble
to shake/to rock
earthquake (old term)
to float/to drift
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
heave/surge
to raise one's head/to perk up
to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
variant of 翕動|翕动[xi1 dong4]
to brush/to caress (of breeze)/to praise
to spin/to whirl around
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to shake/to sway
